problem_text:
A group G is said to be (conjugacy, p-conjugacy) biprimitively finite if, for any finite subgroup H, any two elements of prime order (any two conjugate elements of prime order, of prime order p) in NG(H)/H generate a finite subgroup. Do the elements of finite order in a (conjugacy) biprimitively finite group G form a subgroup (the periodic part of G)?
V. P. Shunkov
answer: Not always (A. A. Cherep, Algebra and Logic, 29 (1987), 311–313).
